main event: An investigator observed a large, bright, round object over Galveston, Texas, on July 20, 1949.
interesting points: The object appeared to stop briefly at a 90-degree angle before quickly disappearing into the west at a tremendous speed., The sighting lasted less than 30 seconds., The object was compared to a large star in apparent size., Weather conditions were described as cloudless with an intense blue sky., The observer and his wife were on the beach when they noticed the object.
